channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Erika Kirk’s act of forgiveness inspired Tim Allen to forgive the drunk driver who killed his father. But experts warn it’s complicated
item.description: Erika Kirk's public declaration inspired other high profile acts of forgiveness, including a church that forgave the gunman that killed four members o...

item.title: These tiny ‘bat bots’ can see in the dark, fly through smoke, and might save your life one day
item.description: “Bats are amazing,” Nitin Sanket, assistant professor of robotics engineering said. “We are nowhere close to what nature has achieved."

item.title: Israel’s Ultra-Orthodox Stage ‘March of the Million’ Against Military Draft
item.description: Hundreds of thousands took to the streets of Jerusalem on Thursday to protest against efforts to end an exemption from military service for Israel’s H...

item.title: Inside the Louvre Jewel Heist That Shocked the World
item.description: More than a week after thieves made off with treasures from the Louvre, a picture is emerging of a seemingly well-planned burglary that exploited secu...

item.title: The uncomfortable secret of successful people: Forget work-life balance, you have to be ‘obsessed’, ex-Wall Streeter and business coach says
item.description: “Obsession means that you’re thinking nonstop until your relentless action makes it unreasonable for you to not win,” she says.

item.title: Volkswagen, Hit by Tariffs, Reports $1.5 Billion Loss and Warns of Chip Shortage
item.description: Europe’s largest automaker said that a shortage of semiconductors could further hurt productivity.

item.title: Chipotle CEO sounds alarm on the American economy: Gen Z and millennials are too burdened by unemployment and student loans to eat out
item.description: “We're not losing them to the competition. We're losing them to grocery and food at home,” Scott Boatwright said.

item.title: America’s officially running out of pennies — and it’s costing retailers millions
item.description: “Let’s rip the waste out of our great nation’s budget, even if it’s a penny at a time,” President Donald Trump wrote on Truth Social.

item.title: From Gaza to New York’s Mayoral Race, Jewish Identity Splits Over Israel’s Future
item.description: Left-wing Jews are wrestling with thorny questions: What will American Jewish communities look like now? And how will they think about Israel?

item.title: French Magazine Acknowledges Breaching Prince William and Catherine’s Privacy
item.description: The couple had sued Paris Match for publishing paparazzi photos of them and their children on a ski vacation.

item.description: Hundreds of thousands took to the streets of Jerusalem on Thursday to protest against efforts to end an exemption from military service for Israel’s H...

item.title: Wilders’s Far-Right Party Faces Rebuke in the Netherlands
item.description: Geert Wilders suffered a loss of support as a center-left party staged major gains, an election result that could offer lessons for Europe’s far right...

item.title: Syria’s Rocky Transition Brings New Waves of Displacement
item.description: More than 400,000 Syrians have been displaced in the year since the civil war ended, according to the United Nations, driven by a mix of sectarian vio...

item.title: Can New York City Buses Be Both Fast and Free?
